question: By what was Paul an apostle of Christ Jesus (Eph. 1:1)
choice: By the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
By faith which is in Christ Jesus

question: The book of Ephesians is address to _________ in Ephesus (Eph. 1:1)
choice: Those who are called in Christ Jesus

question: In the greeting, what does Paul say is from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ (Eph. 1:2)
With what has God blessed the Ephesians in the heavenly realms (Eph. 1:3)
choice: With all grace in Christ Jesus
With the anointing of the spirit

question: Where has God blessed the Ephesians with every spiritual blessing (Eph. 1:3)
choice: In his body which is the church

question: What did the Father do for us before the creation of the world (Eph. 1:4)
When did the Father chose us in Christ (Eph. 1:4)
choice: Before Christ died for our sins
Before he breathed into life into all
Before the creation of the world
Before he made the land and seas

question: For what did the Father choose us before the creation of the world (Eph. 1:4)
choice: To live with all uprightness and gentleness

question: In love to what did the Father predestine us according to the pleasure of his will (Eph. 1:5)
choice: To be a kingdom of priests

question: What has the Father given us freely in the One he loves (Eph. 1:6)
choice: The praise of his glorious grace
The light on our path from the Father of lights

question: In whom/what has the Father has given us freely the praise of his glorious grace (Eph. 1:6)
choice: In the Spirit which indwells us
In mercy to all who believe
In his one and only Son

question: Through what do we have redemption (Eph. 1:7)
choice: Through the washing of our souls

question: What do we have in redemption through his blood (Eph. 1:7)
According to what do we have forgiveness of sin which was lavished on us (Eph. 1:7)
With what were the riches of God’s grace lavished upon us (Eph. 1:8)
What did God make known to us with all wisdom and understanding (Eph 1:9)
When was the mystery of God’s will to be put into effect (Eph. 1:10)
choice: When God’s word had been manifest
When Christ died for our sins according to the Scripture
When the times reach their fulfillment
When the end of all things had come

question: Why would the mystery of his will be put into effect (Eph. 1:10)
choice: To unite the church as one body
To fulfill the word of God
To bring unity to all things

question: We were chosen and were ___________ according to the plan of him who works out everything in conformity to the purpose of his will (Eph. 1:11)
In conformity to what does God work out everything (Eph. 1:11)
choice: The unity of his body the church

question: For what are those who put their hope in Christ (Eph. 1:12)
choice: For the praise of his glory
For lights in a dark world
For the unity of the church

question: Who were for the praise of his glory (Eph. 1:12)
choice: Those who believe on the Son of God
Those who first put their hope in Christ
Those who were called according to his purpose
Those who once were a far off

question: When the Ephesians believed, what does Paul say happened to them (Eph. 1:13)
choice: They were justified in Christ Jesus
They were marked with a seal

question: How does Paul describe the seal by which the Ephesians were marked (Eph. 1:13)
How does Paul describe the mark by which believers are sealed even the promised Holy Spirit (Eph. 1:14)
choice: A sign of the promise of God’s love
A sign of the covenant which was in Christ Jesus

question: Who is the deposit guaranteeing our inheritance (Eph. 1:14)
The Spirit is the guarantee of our inheritance at what time (Eph. 1:14)
choice: The redemption of those who are God’s possession
When Christ takes the throne on the right hand of the Father
The imputation of Christ’s righteousness on believers
The return of Jesus to receive us into glory

question: What did Paul say he had heard about the Ephesians (Eph. 1:15)
choice: Their faith in the Lord Jesus
Their concern for all the saints

question: What did Paul say he had heard about the Ephesians (Eph. 1:15)
choice: Their concern for all the saints
Their love for all God’s people

question: What has Paul not stopped doing (Eph. 1:16)
choice: Sacrificing for the Ephesians day and night

question: What does Paul keep asking the glorious Father might give to the Ephesians (Eph. 1:17)
choice: All power and might in Christ Jesus
The Spirit of wisdom and revelation
The Spirit of humility and kindness

question: To what end does Paul keep asking that God would give them the Spirit of wisdom and revelation (Eph. 1:17)
choice: So that they might love one another
So that they might know him better
So that they would walk in the footsteps of Jesus
So that they would become what they are

question: Paul says that he prays that what would be enlightened (Eph. 1:28)
What does Paul pray they may know and to which he had called them (Eph. 1:28)
God has called them to the hope which is described as the ___________ (Eph. 1:18)
choice: Seal of the promised Holy Spirit
Riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people
The greatness and fullness of his grace in Christ Jesus

question: To what has God called them for those who have believed (Eph. 1:19)
choice: His greatness which is beyond measure

question: After God raised Jesus, where did God seat him (Eph. 1:20)
choice: On his throne above all creation
Above every king and priest and prophet
At his right hand in the heavenly realms
At the head of the body the church

question: After God raised Jesus, God seated him above all rule and authority, power and _______ (Eph. 1:21)
Jesus was given a __________ far above not only in this age but in the age to come (Eph. 1:21)
Where did God place all things (Eph. 1:22)
choice: Under the control of the Spirit

question: What was Christ appointed to be (Eph. 1:22)
choice: The son of God and son of God
The head over everything for the church
The king on the throne of his father David

question: How is the church described in relation to Christ (Eph. 1:23)
How is Christ’s body described (Eph. 1:23)
choice: The fullness of him who fills everything
The perfect which guides us in truth
The manifestation of God’s glory and truth

question: In what does Paul say the Ephesians are dead (Eph. 2:1)
choice: In the lusts of their past lives

question: How is the spirit who is at work in those who are disobedient described (Eph 2:2)
choice: The master of those who are slaves to sin
The ruler of the kingdom of the air

question: In whom is the spirit of the ruler of the kingdom of the air at work (Eph. 2:2)
choice: Those who desire the pleasures of this world
Those who are dead in sin

question: By nature what does Paul say we deserve (Eph. 2:3)
Among what did we all live at one time (Eph. 2:3)
choice: Gratifying the cravings of our flesh
Pursuing our own desires and not those of the Spirit

question: In what is God rich (Eph. 2:4)
What does God have that is great toward us (Eph. 2:4)
Even when we were dead in trespasses what did God make us with Christ (Eph. 2:5)
In what were we dead when God made us alive with Christ (Eph. 2:5)
By what have we been saved (Eph. 2:5, 8)
The grace by which we are saved through faith is not from what (Eph. 2:8)
While we are saved by grace, what are we saved through (Eph. 2:8)
What is the grace that saves us (Eph. 2:8)
choice: It is a gift of God
It is the seal of our salvation

question: Why is grace through faith a gift and not by works (Eph. 2:9)
choice: So that God receives all the glory
So that it is by Christ’s blood
So that all may give thanks

question: Why are we created in Christ Jesus (Eph. 2:10)
choice: To seek his kingdom and his righteousness
To sit with him in the heavenly realms

question: We are God’s ________ created in Christ Jesus for good works (Eph. 2:10)
What were the Gentiles formerly called (Eph. 2:11)
What is done in the body by human hands (Eph. 2:11)
What were the Ephesians foreigners to (Eph. 2:12)
choice: The history of the people of God
The call of our Lord Jesus Christ

question: When the Ephesians were separate from Christ, from what were they excluded (Eph. 2:12)
choice: The seal of the Holy Spirit

question: In the world the Ephesians who at that time were separated from Christ were without what in the world (Eph. 2:12)
How were those who were once far away brought near (Eph. 2:13)
choice: By the seal of the Spirit

question: What did Christ destroy making the two groups one (Eph. 2:14)
What did Christ set aside in his flesh making the two groups one (Eph. 2:15)
choice: The enmity between Jews and Gentiles

question: What was Christ trying to make by creating one new humanity (Eph. 2:15)
Through what did Christ seek to reconcile both groups to God (Eph. 2:16)
What did Christ put to death through the cross (Eph. 2:16)
What did Christ preach both to those who were far away and those who were near (Eph. 2:17)
To whom did Christ preach peace (Eph. 2:17)
To whom do both Jews and Gentiles have access (Eph. 2:18)
By what do both Jews and Gentiles have access to the Father (Eph. 2:18)
What does Paul tell the Ephesians they are no longer (Eph. 2:19)
What did Paul say the Ephesians were not members of (Eph. 2:19)
Who does Paul tell the Ephesians they are fellow citizens with (Eph. 2:19)
Who did Paul say was the foundation built upon (Eph. 2:20)
What does Paul call Jesus after saying the foundation was built on the apostles and prophets (Eph. 2:20)
What does the whole building joint together become in the Lord (Eph. 2:21)
What does Paul say they are being built to become (Eph. 2:22)
choice: A holy nation in Christ Jesus
A dwelling in which God lives
A heavenly Zion in which all live as one

question: What does Paul call himself for the sake of the Gentiles (Eph. 3:1)
Why does Paul call himself a prisoner (Eph. 3:1)
choice: For the sake of you Gentiles
For the sake of Jesus Christ
For the sake of the grace of god
For the sake of the elect

question: What does Paul say was given to him by revelation (Eph. 3:2)
choice: The covenant of promise to the Gentiles

question: What was made known to Paul by revelation (Eph 3:2f)
What will the Ephesians understand by reading Paul’s epistle (Eph. 3:4)
choice: His wisdom received from the Spirit
His insight into the mystery of Christ

question: To whom has the mystery of Christ been revealed (Eph. 3:5)
choice: Only to Paul as a messenger of Christ
The whole church of our Lord Jesus Christ
The bishops and elders of Christ

question: To whom was the mystery of Christ not made known (Eph. 3:5)
choice: To all who are called in Christ
To those who received the old covenant

question: What does Paul say the mystery is that was revealed by the Spirit (Eph. 3:6)
choice: That the Gentiles are heirs with Israel
That God should save all who believe
That the Spirit was now open to all
The forgiveness of sins through Jesus Christ

question: By what means was the mystery revealed to God’s holy apostles and prophets (Eph. 3:5)
What does the mystery indicate that the Gentiles are now sharers in (Eph. 3:6)
choice: The new covenant by the blood of Christ

question: Through what are the Gentiles now heirs together with Israel (Eph. 3:6)
choice: Through the work of the Spirit

question: What metaphor does Paul use to show that the Gentiles are now heirs together with Israel (Eph. 3:6)
Through what did Paul become a servant of this gospel (Eph. 3:7)
choice: Through the work of God’s power
Through the forgiveness offered in Christ

question: What did Paul become by the gift of God’s grace (Eph. 3:7)
What grace was Paul given to preach to the Gentiles (Eph. 3:8)
choice: The forgiveness of sins to all who believe

question: What position did Paul say he had among all the Lord’s people (Eph. 3:8)
Where was the administration of this mystery hidden (Eph. 3:9)
choice: In the seal of the Spirit

question: How was God described in whom the administration was hidden (Eph. 3:9)
choice: As the one who made Paul an apostle
As the one who forgave our sins
As the one who created all things
As the one who chose us in Christ

question: What did God intend to make known now through the church (Eph. 3:10)
Through what did God intend to make known the wisdom of God (Eph. 3:10)
To whom was the wisdom of God made known through the church (Eph. 3:10)
choice: To the authorities of this world

question: Through what may we approach God (Eph. 3:12)
How may we approach God through faith (Eph. 3:12)
What did God accomplish in Christ Jesus our Lord (Eph. 3:11)
What did Paul say was the Ephesians glory (Eph. 3:13)
What does Paul do before the Father from whom every family derives its name (Eph. 3:14)
What does every family in heaven and earth derive from the Father (Eph. 3:14)
Where does Paul pray they may be strengthened (Eph. 3:16)
Through what does Paul pray they may be strengthened in their inner spirit (Eph. 3:16)
choice: Through the word of his grace

question: Through what does Christ dwell in their hearts (Eph. 3:17)
Where does Paul pray Christ may dwell (Eph. 3:17)
What does Paul pray they be rooted in (Eph. 3:17)
What does Paul pray they, along with the Lord’s holy people, may grasp (Eph. 3:18)
What does Paul say love surpasses (Eph. 3:19)
What does Paul pray they will be filled with (Eph. 3:19)
What does Paul say God is able to do immeasurably more than (Eph. 3:20)
choice: More than we could hope for
More than the sand of the sea
More than we ask or image
More than the heights of heaven

question: What does Paul say is at work in us more than we can ask or imagine (Eph. 3:20)
What should be to God in the church throughout all generations (Eph. 3:21)
As what does Paul write the Ephesians, urging them to live a life worthy of their calling (Eph. 4:1)
choice: As a messenger of the gospel

question: What does Paul urge them to live a life worthy of (Eph. 4:1)
choice: The gift they have been given
The grace that they had received
The promise they had been promised

question: What did Paul tell them to be completely (Eph. 4:2)
What does Paul urge the Ephesians to do in love (Eph. 4:2)
What did Paul tell the Ephesians they should make every effort to keep (Eph. 4:3)
What does Paul tell them they were called to (Eph. 4:4)
What did Paul parallel to there being one body (Eph. 4:4)
Paul says there is one Lord, one faith and one ________ (Eph. 4:5)
How does Paul describe the one God and Father as (Eph. 4:6)
choice: The one who calls us in Christ Jesus
The king in the heavenly realms

question: How much grace has each one of us been given (Eph. 4:7)
choice: As the Father has poured it out on us
As the Spirit has delivered it

question: What does Paul say has been given to each one of us (Eph. 4:7)
When Christ ascended on high what did he take (Eph. 4:8)
choice: His seat in the heavenly realms

question: When did Christ give gifts to his people (Eph. 4:8)
choice: When he sat at the Father’s right hand
When he rose from the dead

question: To where did Christ descend (Eph. 4:9)
choice: To the depths of the sea
To the depths of the earth

question: Why did Christ ascend higher than all the heavens (Eph. 4:10)
choice: To overcome the power of Satan

question: Paul says, Christ gave all of the following EXCEPT (Eph. 4:11)
Why the Christ give apostles and prophets (Eph. 4:12)
choice: To lead the church to the fullness of love
To instruct the body of Christ
To equip his people for works of service
To bring the church into one body

question: Why the Christ give apostles and prophets (Eph. 4:12)
choice: So that all the members of Christ’s body may be one
So that the peace of God may reign
So that the people of God may complete their calling
So that the body of Christ may be built up

question: What did Christ give apostles and prophets for the attaining of (Eph. 4:13)
choice: The holiness of the Father and peace of the Spirit
The whole measure of the fullness of Christ
The complete unity of the body of Christ

question: What unity does Paul describe that we will reach being equipped by evangelists and pastors (Eph. 4:13)
choice: Unity in the faith and knowledge of the Son of God
Unity in belief and goals for which they were strive
Unity in mind and body for the full church of Christ

question: The goal of the unity in faith and knowledge of the Son of God was to become _______ (Eph. 4:13)
If we become mature, what will we no longer be (Eph. 4:14)
When we are no longer infants, what will not happen (Eph. 4:14)
choice: We will not believe every false doctrine and teaching
We will not be led astray as little children
We will not be tossed back and forth by the waves
We will not swing from one side to the other

question: What kind of wind will not blow us here and there if we are mature (Eph. 4:14)
To what end do people use cunning and craftiness (Eph. 4:14)
What should be spoken in love (Eph 4:15)
Christ is said to be what part of the body (Eph. 4:15)
What must each part of the body do (Eph. 4:16)
By what is the body joined and held together (Eph. 4:16)
choice: By every thought and intent of the heart

question: What does the body do in love (Eph. 4:16)
As what must they no longer live their lives (Eph. 4:17)
How do the Gentiles live (Eph. 4:17)
choice: In the futility of their thinking
In opposition to the truth of Christ
With no understanding of the law

question: From what are the Gentiles separated (Eph. 4:18)
In what are the Gentiles darkened (Eph. 4:18)
What is the ignorance of the Gentiles is due to (Eph. 4:18)
choice: Their rejection of the law of God

question: To what have the Gentiles given themselves over to (Eph. 4:19)
What are the Gentiles full of (Eph. 4:19)
In what do the Gentiles indulge (Eph. 4:19)
choice: All the vices of the body

question: How were the Ephesians taught (Eph. 4:20)
choice: According to the truth that is in Jesus
According to the mercies of God
According to the indwelling Holy Spirit
According to their calling in Christ

question: What were the Ephesians taught to put off (Eph. 4:22)
By what was their old selves corrupted (Eph. 4:22)
choice: Rebellion against everything that is good

question: For what was the new self created (Eph. 4:24)
choice: To become part of the body

question: How is the new self created to be like God (Eph. 4:24)
What does Paul tell them each of them must do to their neighbors (Eph. 4:25)
What are we not to do in our anger (Eph. 4:26)
When one is angry, what should they not do (Eph. 4:26)
What is not to be given to the devil (Eph. 4:27)
What must a person who no longer steals do (Eph. 4:28)
choice: Not get angry when they are caught
Resist the devil so that he flees

question: Why should those who used to steal work (Eph. 4:28)
choice: So that they can follow Paul’s example
So that they can follow Christ
So they can share with those in need
So they can repay what they have stolen

question: What should not come out of your mouth (Eph. 4:29)
What should one not do to the Holy Spirit of God (Eph. 4:30)
All of the following are listed as vices to be gotten rid of EXCEPT (Eph. 4:31)
What should we be to one another (Eph. 4:32)
What should we do just as in Christ God did (Eph. 4:32)
choice: Speak to one another in spiritual songs and words

question: Whose example does Paul say to follow as loved children (Eph. 5:1)
In what way does Paul tell the Ephesians to walk (Eph. 5:2)
How did Christ offer himself up for us in love (Eph. 5:2)
choice: As a tender lamb of God
As an aroma pleasing to the Lord
Shedding his own blood as a lamb without spot and blemish
As a fragrant offering and sacrifice

question: How does Paul say Christ loved us as a model we are to follow (Eph. 5:2)
choice: Forgiving our sins and all who believe
With prayers and supplications to God

question: Paul tells them there must not even be a hint of all of the following among them EXCEPT (Eph. 5:3)
Paul lists all of the following as out of place EXCEPT (Eph. 5:4)
For whom does Paul say greed and impurity are improper (Eph. 5:3)
Instead of coarse joking and foolish talk, what does Paul say should be (Eph. 5:4)
All of the following are listed as not having any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ EXCEPT (Eph. 5:5)
How does Paul label people who are immoral, impure and greedy (Eph. 5:5)
In what do people who are immoral, impure and greedy not have an inheritance in (Eph. 5:5)
choice: The kingdom of Christ and God

question: With what does Paul warn them not to be deceived (Eph. 5:6)
What does Paul say comes on the disobedient (Eph. 5:6)
On whom does Paul say the wrath of God comes (Eph. 5:6)
What kind of children should they live as (Eph. 5:8)
All of the following are listed as the fruit of light EXCEPT (Eph. 5:9)
What does Paul tell them they should find out (Eph. 5:10)
With what does Paul tell them not to have anything to do with (Eph. 5:11)
What does Paul say they should do to the fruitless deeds of darkness (Eph. 5:11)
What is shameful even to mention (Eph. 5:12)
choice: The works of the evil one
What they do upon whom the wrath of God comes
What the disobedient do in secret

question: What becomes visible (Eph. 5:13)
choice: Everything revealed on that final day
All the wonderful works of God

question: What will Christ do on the sleeper and dead (Eph. 5:14)
Who will Christ shine on as it is said (Eph. 5:14)
choice: Those doing the deeds of darkness

question: Why should one make the most of every opportunity (Eph. 5:16)
choice: Because it may not come again

question: Paul tells them they should be careful to live as ________ (Eph. 5:15)
What does Paul suggest they should understand rather than being foolish (Eph. 5:17)
choice: How great the mystery of God is

question: What does Paul say they should do rather than getting drunk (Eph. 5:18)
choice: Be sober in word and deed

question: What does Paul say they should not do as opposed being filled with the Spirit (Eph. 5:18)
To what does drunkenness lead (Eph. 5:18)
Paul tells them they should speak to one another in all of the following manners EXCEPT (Eph. 5:19)
What should they do from their heart to the Lord (Eph. 5:19)
What does Paul say they should always do to God the Father (Eph. 5:20)
How does Paul say we should give thanks in everything to God (Eph. 5:20)
choice: In the power of the Holy Spirit
With bowed heads before the Father
In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ

question: Why should they submit to one another (Eph. 5:21)
choice: Out of the fear of the Lord

question: What does Paul direct wives to do (Eph. 5:22)
choice: Love their husbands with all their hearts

question: How were wives to submit to their husbands (Eph. 5:22)
choice: As the church does to Christ

question: What metaphor does Paul use to the husband’s relationship to his wife (Eph. 5:23)
How is Christ’s relationship to the church described? He is it’s _______ (Eph. 5:23)
The church is described as Christ’s _______ (Eph. 5:23)
What should the church do to Christ (Eph. 5:24)
What are husbands to do for their wives (Eph. 5:25)
How did Christ love the church (Eph. 5:25)
choice: He gave himself up for her
He shed his precious blood for her

question: Why did Christ give himself up for the church (Eph. 5:26)
choice: To make her without spot and blemish

question: How did Christ cleanse the church (Eph. 5:26)
choice: By anointing her with the oil of the Spirit
By sending his Spirit to purify her without spot
By the washing with water through the word
By shedding his own precious blood for her

question: Christ presented the church to himself in all of the following ways EXCEPT (Eph. 5:27)
How should husbands love their wives (Eph. 5:28)
choice: As much as they love other members of the church
As much as they love the things of this world
As much as they love their own bodies
As much as they love Christ

question: What has no one ever hated (Eph. 5:29)
Of what are we members (Eph. 5:30)
For his wife, whom should a man leave (Eph. 5:31)
In marriage, what do the two become (Eph. 5:31)
In speaking of the unity in marriage, what profound mystery is Paul speaking about (Eph. 5:32)
choice: The union of a man and a woman

question: What must the wife do for her husband (Eph. 5:33)
How much must the husband love his wife (Eph. 5:33)
choice: As much as he loves the church
As much as he loves himself
As much as he loves Christ
As much as he loves his father and mother

question: What is right for children to do (Eph. 6:1)
Honoring your father and mother is the first commandment with what (Eph. 6:2)
What is the first commandment with a promise (Eph. 6:2)
The commandment to honor one’s father and mother will result in _____ (Eph. 6:3)
What should fathers not do to their children (Eph. 6:4)
What should fathers do for their children (Eph. 6:4)
choice: Give them an inheritance in the Lord and in the church
Bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord
Guide them into the fear of the Lord and teach them wisdom
Train them in the way they should go so they may live long

question: What should slaves do to their masters (Eph. 6:5)
What attitude should slaves have toward their masters (Eph. 6:5)
How should slaves not obey their masters (Eph. 6:6)
choice: Not out of envy and jealousy
Not just to win their favor

question: How should Christian slaves serve their masters (Eph. 6:7)
How should Christian slaves serve their masters (Eph. 6:7)
choice: As if they were an honorable king
As if they were their parents

question: For slaves what will the Lord reward (Eph. 6:8)
choice: Faithful service in the name of Christ
Loyalty and service in the name of Christ

question: What should masters not do to their slaves (Eph. 6:9)
What should masters keep in mind (Eph. 6:9)
choice: They all serve the same king
That both of them have a Master in heaven
That Christ died for both of them
That they are now brothers and sisters in Christ

question: What is not found with their Master in heaven (Eph. 6:9)
In what should we be strong (Eph. 6:10)
choice: In the calling by which you were called

question: Why should they put on the full armor of God (Eph. 6:11)
choice: So that they may be victorious on the day of Christ
So that they may protect themselves from evil
So that they may stand against the devil’s schemes
So that they may fulfill the fullness of Christ

question: What should they do to stand against the devil’s schemes (Eph. 6:11)
choice: Resist the devil so that he flees
Put on the full armor of God
Come into the fortress of God

question: What is our struggle not with (Eph. 6:12)
choice: Kings and rulers of this world

question: What is our struggle against (Eph. 6:12)
choice: Lusts of the flesh and blood
The forces of the evil one

question: What is our struggle against (Eph. 6:12)
choice: Lusts of the flesh and blood
Pride of life conquering this dark world
Spiritual forces of evil in heavenly realms
The armies of the evil one in this world

question: What should one put on so that they may stand when the day of evil comes (Eph. 6:13)
choice: The grace and mercy of God

question: What belt is to be buckled around your waist as part of the full armor of God (Eph. 6:14)
What should be in place from the full armor of God (Eph. 6:14)
choice: The belt of the word of God

question: What should your feet be fitted with making them ready (Eph. 6:15)
What kind of shield was part of the full armor of God (Eph. 6:16)
What can the shield of faith do (Eph. 6:16)
choice: Defend against the darts of the devil
Resist the wiles of the rulers of this dark world
Extinguish the flaming arrows of the evil one

question: In the armor of God, what is the helmet (Eph. 6:17)
In the armor of God, what is the sword (Eph. 6:17)
What is the sword of the Spirit (Eph. 6:17)
What should one do on all occasions (Eph. 6:18)
For what should one always pray with all kinds of prayers and requests (Eph. 6:18)

choice: That he might be able to preach the gospel in Rome
That he may himself put on the whole armor of God
That he may make known the mystery of the gospel
That he may not fall away as many of Israel did

choice: An apostle of the mystery of the gospel
A soldier of Christ in full armor

question: Who will tell the Ephesians everything so they may know how Paul is doing (Eph. 6:21)

choice: The dear brother and faithful servant
A hard worker for the Lord and for them

question: Why Paul was sending Tychicus to the Ephesians (Eph. 6:22)
choice: So that he may have some fruit among them
So that he may encourage them
So that he may call them to repentance
So that he may present the gospel to them
